comment: Ming Chen was one of the best professors I had. She is harsh and she will critique your work, but she cares and wants to help your work become the best it can be. She is a wealth of information and has a huge resume.

I had Professor Chen for Visual Imagination and I LOVED her. She is very blunt in her critiques, but everything she says only helps you get better. As long as you pay attention and do the work assigned, she'll love you. Mostly projects, and you need to buy things to complete them. Any bad reviews are from people who didn't want to do the work TRUST
rating_tags: Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback--Lots of homework

comment: I've taken Professor Ming three times so far, and I have enjoyed her each time! She can be a bit blunt with her feedback, but it's really a result of culture difference. She lets you know exactly what's expected in her rubric packages. Just make sure you tick off each part of the rubric and things are submitted in the correct format !
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Participation matters

comment: I took Ming Chen for visual imagination. Chen is clearly very knowledgeable and passionate about design. Her feedback my sound too direct and condescending, but she does not mean for her feedback to be that way as critiques are seen differently in the culture she is from. Read the directions carefully and put in the work and you will be fine.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader--Clear grading criteria

comment: She is very rude and disrespectful. She has a very condescending tone and has her expectations set too high for the current circumstances. Do not take her, I was thrilled to get out of her class.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: For this to be a visual imagination class, Ming is super objective in how she grades which is not really legitimate considering it's an art class. She is a really tough grader and is pretty condescending during class. Attendance is mandatory and she'll call you out if you aren't there. 0/10 would not take her again.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: The professor is very knowledgeable. She raised my interesting level in design.
The projects are really fun!
The projects are fund and helpful in understanding the design principle and concepts.
inspirational.
Individual attention and critique
Professor Chen is very knowledgeable on her subject matter, and is very approachable and available to help students.

This course was very challenging for a student who has never had any technical experience at the scene shop, and directions were not always clear. However, grasping concepts of the content has helped me become more precise in patterning and drawing. The instructor was effective in helping me learn.

Very knowledgeable and always asking f anyone needed more help or further explanation. The only improvement I can suggest is for the midterm exam. For me it was a very lengthly process which took me over two hours to complete. Perhaps divide this exam into two sections to be done for two class periods.
Dr. Chen obviously has extensive knowledge of design in theater as a whole and is a well rounded teacher of the profession and art.

Wow, I am so pleased with the amount of information and skills we learned. I only wish I had time to take more classes from Professor Chen. I would love to continue to learn about more advanced drafting skills.

Professor Chen is very thorough in her instruction and examples. Her syllabus and class is organized and flows nicely throughout the semester. She is quick to point out where the student needs to improve and gives us time to do so. This was my favorite class, it was such a pleasure to attend.
She was willing to help with any situation and was very understanding with projects.
The instructor was effective in helping me learn.

Very knowledgeable about the material. she has real world experience in the field and that is really beneficial for the students. the book is helpful, especially for examples of projects so you know you're doing it right.
I think it is important that we learn about these design concepts even if your concentration is not design.

Great person- not a great teacher. Projects are easy but test are all trick questions. Does not budge on grades. Hard to understand. Instructions are never clear. Does not respond to emails. No final- only one test. Projects you can BS and make A's. She literally wrote the textbook (with lots of grammatical errors may I add)
Bad english, forgetfull, bad teacher, unwilling to compromise when a test question so obviously has multiple answers. Turns a breeze class into the defintion of a boring.
very easy!!!!
No Comments

She can not speak english!! I can never understand her, but since she doesn't teach her own class EVER, it does not matter.  Ming Chen has only taught 3 classes out of a whole semester, we have had guests for the entire semester.  She has no contorl over her class.
I NEVER UNDERSTOOD ANYTHING SHE SAID!  NEEDS TO TAKE ENGLISH CLASSES
I never went to class because it was so boring; didnt go to any of the performances, just made things up and got a B.  I wouldnt reccommend her at all.

Well I liked her cause she reminds me of my friend who is asian so I am use to that accent... but really you dont have to even deal with her that much cause different prof teach as well... trust me she isnt that bad!
poor english (from China) very hard to understand. no control of class, constant changes to syllabus, no leadership abilities. class ok, but teacher hard to learn from.
